sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The combers whistle or, The sport of the spring. This story plain will make appear, what mettle-men the Combers are, and what they are no whit afraid, to entertain a pretty maid; the pleasant time in mirth they spent, whereas he gave her good content. Tune of, The Carmans whistle. With allowance. R. L'Estrange.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clarke., [London] : [between 1674-1679]
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing. Verse: "All in a pleasant morning ..." Trimmed. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
